paragraphs.body: ${link_0} depict the Dancing Dragon in the ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: Statues depict the Dancing Dragon in the Sun Warriors' ancient city.

paragraphs.body: The Dancing Dragon is a traditional ${link_0} form practiced by the ${link_1}, who learned it from the original firebenders, the ${link_2}, in the ${link_3}. ${link_4} and ${link_5} later learned this technique while on a journey to the ancient ${link_6} in order to find a way to master firebending.
paragraphs.text: The Dancing Dragon is a traditional firebending form practiced by the Sun Warriors, who learned it from the original firebenders, the dragons, in the era of Raava. Zuko and Aang later learned this technique while on a journey to the ancient Sun Warrior ruins in order to find a way to master firebending.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} learned the Dancing Dragon movements directly from a ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: Wan learned the Dancing Dragon movements directly from a dragon.

paragraphs.body: During his banishment in the ${link_0}, ${link_1} ${link_2} became the first practitioner of the Dancing Dragon, developing the technique by copying the movements of a white dragon that lived there. He later used this technique to protect the forest from hunters, his fluid style of bending proving too much for them to overcome.
paragraphs.text: During his banishment in the Spirit Wilds, Avatar Wan became the first practitioner of the Dancing Dragon, developing the technique by copying the movements of a white dragon that lived there. He later used this technique to protect the forest from hunters, his fluid style of bending proving too much for them to overcome.

paragraphs.body: At some point toward the end of the ${link_0}, ${link_1} learned this form from the dragons ${link_2} and incorporated it into his own fighting style.
paragraphs.text: At some point toward the end of the Hundred Year War, Iroh learned this form from the dragons Ran and Shaw and incorporated it into his own fighting style.

paragraphs.body: In 100 ${link_0}, Zuko and Aang traveled to the ruins of the ancient Sun Warrior civilization, as the prince's firebending had weakened due to the loss of his original motivation and former rampant rage. Aang and Zuko learned the Dancing Dragon technique by imitating a series of statues they discovered in a locked room within the seemingly abandoned city; the statues demonstrated the Dancing Dragon just as it was practiced in the era before the Avatar.
paragraphs.text: In 100 AG, Zuko and Aang traveled to the ruins of the ancient Sun Warrior civilization, as the prince's firebending had weakened due to the loss of his original motivation and former rampant rage. Aang and Zuko learned the Dancing Dragon technique by imitating a series of statues they discovered in a locked room within the seemingly abandoned city; the statues demonstrated the Dancing Dragon just as it was practiced in the era before the Avatar.

paragraphs.body: After being discovered by the Sun Warriors, Aang and Zuko performed the movements when their worthiness to learn firebending was being judged by the dragons Ran and Shaw; Aang referred to this as "dancing with the dragons". After their performance, Ran and Shaw deemed Aang and Zuko worthy to understand the true meaning of firebending.
paragraphs.text: After being discovered by the Sun Warriors, Aang and Zuko performed the movements when their worthiness to learn firebending was being judged by the dragons Ran and Shaw; Aang referred to this as "dancing with the dragons". After their performance, Ran and Shaw deemed Aang and Zuko worthy to understand the true meaning of firebending.

paragraphs.body: When Zuko incorporated the Dancing Dragon into his fighting style, it greatly improved his skills, to the point where he was able to duel ${link_0}, who was considered a firebending prodigy, on even terms.
paragraphs.text: When Zuko incorporated the Dancing Dragon into his fighting style, it greatly improved his skills, to the point where he was able to duel his sister, who was considered a firebending prodigy, on even terms.

paragraphs.body: When performed by two people at the same time, the final move of the Dancing Dragon creates an arch between them.
paragraphs.text: When performed by two people at the same time, the final move of the Dancing Dragon creates an arch between them.

paragraphs.body: The Dancing Dragon is based on three types of attacks: low kicks, high punches or hits, and double punches with both fists. The Dancing Dragon has a similar appearance to Northern Shaolin Kung-Fu: it is fierce, quick, and very strong.
paragraphs.text: The Dancing Dragon is based on three types of attacks: low kicks, high punches or hits, and double punches with both fists. The Dancing Dragon has a similar appearance to Northern Shaolin Kung-Fu: it is fierce, quick, and very strong.
